result.execSummary:
The defendant Oscar Lee Dorrise Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Commencing forthwith.  Time shall be served with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.  Transfer authorized to a jail convenient to defendant's employment or residence.
Concurrent with: with any sentence defendant is serving.

Court costs shall be paid at a rate of $25 per month commencing 12-01-2022 and the first of each month thereafter until paid in full or judgment shall be entered or nonpayment.  
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Washington County Sheriff's Office Jail Disposition of Prisoners

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in court in custody without counsel.  Case recalled.  Resolution reached.  State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 2.  Guilty plea entered on Ct. 1.  Court finds defendant guilty on Ct. 1 and orders Ct. 2 dismissed and read in.  Court proceeds to sentencing.

Prosecuting Attorney Mark David Bensen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant in court in custody without counsel.  Defendant appears on an OTP from MSDF.  Defendant given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Not guilty pleas entered by Court.  Defendant waives right to attorney. $500 signature bond set.  Case passed to allow pretrial with DA.
(Copy sent to State Pub Def's Office)

Prosecuting Attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin. No appearance by defendant.  Case called at 11:42 a.m.  Court notes the defendant is currently at the Milwaukee Secure Detention Center.  Initial Appearance adjourned to allow defendant to be produced in person for July 19, 2022 at 3:30 p.m.  State to prepare an OTP.
Initial appearance on July 19, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Initial appearance on June 29, 2022 at 09:45 am.
